meanings.definition: A repeated rhythmic phrase or song.
meanings.sent1: The monks sang a beautiful chant during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The fans joined in the chant at the football game.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to have their own little chant going on.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the waves crashing on the shore was like a soothing chant.
meanings.sent5: The chant of the cicadas filled the summer evening with music.

meanings.definition: To sing or recite in a monotonous, repetitive tone.
meanings.sent1: She would chant the same nursery rhyme every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: The protesters began to chant slogans outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it was funny to chant their spelling words in silly voices.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to chant through the trees on that eerie night.
meanings.sent5: Her voice seemed to chant a spell that mesmerized all who heard it.
